title: How to Establish an Effective Skincare Routine

steps.title: Remove makeup.
steps.content: Remove makeup. If you wear makeup, you should remove it before you go to bed. Some cleansers claim to remove makeup for you, but these may not get rid of all makeup. You may want to have an extra makeup remover on hand. Use it before you cleanse your face. [1] X Research source Makeup wipes or removers are easy and convenient. Simply wipe off the makeup with a soaked pad until it is gone. Since eye and lip makeup can be harder to remove, you may want to use a special makeup remover designed for these parts.

steps.title: Cleanse twice a day.
steps.content: Cleanse twice a day. You should wash your face twice a day, once in the morning before you put on makeup, and once at night before you go to bed. You should also cleanse after sweating heavily. [2] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Wet your skin with warm water but not hot water. Warm water helps remove dirt, but hot water will dry out your skin. Apply the cleanser and massage it onto your skin in upwards, circular motions. Remove completely, either by using a sponge or by splashing with warm water. Dab your face dry with a clean towel.

steps.title: Apply toner after your cleanser.
steps.content: Apply toner after your cleanser. Toner should be applied once you have dried your face after cleansing. Pump a small amount of toner onto a cotton pad, and simply wipe over your face. Avoid the eye area. Let the toner dry on your skin. You do not need to rinse off. [3] X Expert Source Diana Yerkes Skincare Professional Expert Interview. 16 April 2019. If you have dry or sensitive skin, find an alcohol-free toner. [4] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: Moisturize your skin.
steps.content: Moisturize your skin. Your moisturizer goes on after your toner absorbs. You can massage your moisturizer into your skin using upward circular motions to your face and neck. Alternatively, you can apply it to your clean palms and gently pat it in. [5] X Expert Source Diana Yerkes Skincare Professional Expert Interview. 16 April 2019. If you have dark or puffy eyes or if you are concerned about wrinkles around your eyes, you can use a separate eye cream. Gently pat the cream around your eye with your ring finger.

steps.title: Exfoliate once or twice a week.
steps.content: Exfoliate once or twice a week. You should only exfoliate once or twice a week, or else you may cause damage to your skin. Be gentle as you exfoliate. Soft movements are all that are needed. Vigorously rubbing or scrubbing can be harmful. [6] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source There are many different types of exfoliation . You can use a wash-off scrub, a special mitt or sponge, or even a chemical exfoliant such as AHA or BHA. You may want to avoid exfoliating if you have active acne breakouts or hyperpigmentation. [7] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: Wear sunscreen everyday.
steps.content: Wear sunscreen everyday. Daily sun exposure can cause premature aging, hyperpigmentation, and other problems. Even if you donâ€™t plan on going outside for long, put on sunscreen before you leave home. Your sunscreen should be SPF 30 or higher. [8] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Apply it fifteen minutes before going outside. [9] X Research source Sunscreen should be applied as the last step of your routine after you have put on moisturizer but before you have put on any makeup. Reader Poll: We asked 1393 wikiHow readers what they found most helpful for establishing a morning routine, and 55% of them said Setting an alarm. [Take Poll] So, set the alarm early enough to give you time for your morning skincare.

steps.title: Choose a foaming cleanser.
steps.content: Choose a foaming cleanser. Foaming cleansers work the best for oily skin as they remove oil gently. You only need a small amount for your whole face. Foaming cleansers come in gel, pump, and cream form. [10] X Research source Be careful only to wash your face twice a day. Washing too often can actually cause your skin to produce more oil and pimples.

steps.title: Look for ingredients that will fight acne.
steps.content: Look for ingredients that will fight acne. If you have acne-prone skin, then you should be using tougher ingredients that will reduce oil, shine, and pimples. Some common and effective ingredients include: [11] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Benzoyl peroxide Salicylic acid Sulfur Alpha hydroxy acids such as glycolic acid or lactic acid Retinoid Witch hazel

steps.title: Apply a water-based moisturizer.
steps.content: Apply a water-based moisturizer. Using a heavy moisturizer might make your skin even oilier. To combat this, use a water or gel-based moisturizer instead. These are moisturizers where water is listed as the first or second ingredient. [12] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Relax with a clay mask to reduce oil.
steps.content: Relax with a clay mask to reduce oil. Clay masks are great for people with oily skin. Smear them on your face after cleansing, and leave them on for fifteen to twenty minutes before rinsing off. Apply moisturizer afterwards. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Avoid touching your face.
steps.content: Avoid touching your face. Touching your face can transfer bacteria and dirt from your hands to your face. These can cause pimples. If you must touch your face, wash your hands thoroughly with soap and warm water first. Never pick, squeeze, or pop your pimples. It hurts more, looks worse, and eventually may leave behind an ugly scar.

steps.title: Rinse your face in the morning.
steps.content: Rinse your face in the morning. Since cleansers can strip your skin of good oils, you do not need to use them in the morning. Instead, rinse your face with warm water and pat dry. Wash your face with cleanser at night. [14] X Expert Source Diana Yerkes Skincare Professional Expert Interview. 16 April 2019.

steps.title: Oil cleanse to remove makeup.
steps.content: Oil cleanse to remove makeup. Makeup removers often contain alcohol and other harsh ingredients that can dry out and irritate your skin. Oil cleansers are gentler than makeup removing wipes. Simply apply the oil to your dry skin, and wash off with warm water. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Use a serum before you apply moisturizer.
steps.content: Use a serum before you apply moisturizer. A serum is a watery moisturizer that gives your skin an extra boost of hydration. Gently dab the serum onto your face with a cotton ball or clean hands. Let it absorb into your skin before you apply moisturizer.

steps.title: Apply a cream with oils.
steps.content: Apply a cream with oils. If you have dry or mature skin, oil-based products will not only add hydration but seal moisture into your skin. Check the label to see if oil is one of the first listed ingredients. [16] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Mineral oil or petrolatum may be helpful if you have cracked skin or flaky patches. Rosehip oil and jojoba oil can help prevent moisture from leaving your skin.

steps.title: Pick soothing ingredients if you have irritation.
steps.content: Pick soothing ingredients if you have irritation. Irritation and flaky skin can be common for both dry and sensitive skin types. To soothe your skin, pick products that contain moisturizing ingredients, such as aloe, chamomile, green tea extract, or Vitamin C. [17] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Note that high amounts of Vitamin C can cause dryness. If you're experiencing dryness, try Magnesium ascorbic phosphate. [18] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source

steps.title: Avoid alcohol and other astringents.
steps.content: Avoid alcohol and other astringents. Alcohol can dry out skin and irritate sensitive skin. Read the ingredients of all of your products so that you can avoid alcohol. In addition to alcohol, you should avoid irritating ingredients like: [19] X Research source Witch hazel Peppermint Eucalyptus oil Fragrance Acids (note that Hyaluronic acid retains water and will not dry out your skin) [20] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source

steps.title: Look for antioxidants to reduce signs of aging.
steps.content: Look for antioxidants to reduce signs of aging. Antioxidants can help prevent signs of aging such as fine lines and wrinkles. Common ones one include Vitamin C, retinol, tea extracts, grape seed extracts, and niacinamide. [21] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source While they are not antioxidants, alpha-hydroxy acids, such as glycolic acid and lactic acid, can help reduce the appearance of fine lines.

steps.title: Treat uneven skin tones with lightening ingredients.
steps.content: Treat uneven skin tones with lightening ingredients. If you want to reduce hyperpigmentation or dark spots on your face, choose ingredients that will lighten these areas. Some products that may be effective include: [22] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Kojic acid Vitamin C Vitamin E Arbutin Niacinamide Licorice Root Extract

steps.title: Use brightening products if you have dull skin.
steps.content: Use brightening products if you have dull skin. Dull skin is a common side effect of dry or mature skin. If you are looking for more of a glow, try to find products that contain Vitamin C, arbutin, niacinamide, and mulberry extract. [23] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source These products are more effective when used together, so feel free to mix and match.

steps.title: Choose mild products if you have rosacea.
steps.content: Choose mild products if you have rosacea . To avoid flares, choose a mild cleanser and moisturizer. [24] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source You should avoid products that contain alcohol, menthol, peppermint, eucalyptus oil, or witch hazel. [25] X Research source For the best treatment, talk to a doctor about getting a prescription to treat your condition.

steps.title: Visit a dermatologist.
steps.content: Visit a dermatologist. If you are struggling to find products that work for your skin, visit a dermatologist. They can help you identify your skin type while pinpointing the underlying issues that may be causing your concerns. They may even give you prescriptions that can help. [26] X Expert Source Diana Yerkes Skincare Professional Expert Interview. 16 April 2019.
